column1: William Francis Readdy is a former Associate Administrator of the Office of Space Flight, at NASA Headquarters.
He was born January 24, 1952, in Quonset Point, Rhode Island, and is married to Colleen Nevius.

column2: They have two sons and a daughter.

column1: He's a distinguished graduate of the U.S. Naval Test Pilot School 1980.
He also belongs to the Association of Space Explorers.
Readdy currently serves on the Board of Directors of the Challenger Center for Space Science Education as Treasurer.
U.S. Naval Test Pilot School Instructor of the Year (1984).
Federation Aeronautique Internationale awards include: the Kamarov Diploma (STS-51), the De la Vaulx Medal (STS-79) and a World Record Certificate (STS-79).
Readdy graduated from Annapolis in 1974, and earned his wings as a Naval Aviator.
Upon completion of the Naval Test Pilot School, he served as project test pilot on a variety of programs at Strike Aircraft Test Directorate.
Following a tour as a test pilot instructor, he reported in 1984 to the USSCoral Sea, on Caribbean and Mediterranean deployments.
He has logged 7,000 flying hours in over 60 types of fixed wing and helicopters and over 550 carrier landings.
He was selected as an astronaut in the 1987 Group.
Readdy is a veteran pilot astronaut with three space flights, STS-42 (January 2230, 1992), STS-51 (September 1222, 1993) and, most recently, STS-79 (September 1626, 1996).
Readdy has logged over 672 hours in space.
